page.name: Course overview
page.content:
Welcome to the Creating Adult Pre-apprenticeships course.

This course has been designed to help adult education providers design new Pre-apprenticeship programs. It is also intended to support providers who are refining existing pre-apprenticeships or implementing similar Integrated Education and Training Programs. The content includes examples and resources that are relevant to a range of adult education providers and a variety of industries.

The course consists of four modules, which each contain two to three topics. The modules are in sequential order — reflecting the key steps for designing a pre-apprenticeship program — but you may find you need to move back and forth between them depending on your needs and schedule. If you are looking to start a new program, it is recommended you start at the beginning. For others, you may wish to focus on specific topics that are most relevant to your organization.

The course is designed to be self-paced. It will take about eight hours to review the content and complete the main activities in the course. However, some of the activities require you to spend time conducting research and reaching out to different organizations and potential Partners. These activities may take several weeks or months, depending on your goals and priorities.

Module 1: Understanding pre-apprenticeships

  1. Topic 1.1: Understanding pre-apprenticeships
  2. Module 1: Conclusion and reflection

Module 2: Working with industry

  1. Topic 2.1: Identifying and interpreting workforce data 
  2. Topic 2.2: Partnering with employers and apprenticeships
  3. Module 2: Conclusion and reflection

Module 3: Designing your pre-apprenticeship

  1. Topic 3.1: Setting entry and completion requirements
  2. Topic 3.2: Identifying learning activities
  3. Topic 3.3: Supporting your participants
  4. Module 3: Conclusion and reflection

Module 4: Managing your pre-apprenticeship

  1. Topic 4.1: Measuring outcomes
  2. Topic 4.2: Outreach and recruitment
  3. Module 4: Conclusion and reflection
